vlibtour.vlibtour_emulation_visit

Class VisitEmulationServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • vlibtour.vlibtour_emulation_visit.VisitEmulationServer

  • @Path(value="/visitemulation")
public final class VisitEmulationServer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides utility methods for the visit of tourists. You are free to complement or modify this code.

    The data structures are designed to allow the management of the visit of several users.

    A limitation of the current implementation is that there is only one graph of positions. The limitation is imposed by the usage of the class GraphOfPositionsForEmulation.

    A regular usage of this server is as follows:

    • getCurrentPosition: to know where a user is;
    • getNextPOIPosition: to know the position of the next POI, i.e. the end of current path of a user;
    • stepInCurrentPath: to move to the next position in the current path of a user. When a user is at the end of their path, stepInCurrentPath returns the same position;
    • stepsInVisit: this calls is used when a user is at their POI in order to know the position of the next POI in the visit. When a user is at the end of their visit, stepsInVisit returns the same position.
    Author:
    Denis Conan

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.lang.InterruptedException
        the main method.

        It initialises the visits of the tourists, and afterwards it starts Grizzly HTTP server exposing JAX-RS resources.

        Parameters:
        args - there is no command line arguments.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - problem when reading stdin.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - abrupt interruption to terminate.

      • getNextPOIPosition

        @GET
 @Path(value="/getNextPOIPosition/{user}")
 @Produces(value="application/json")
public static vlibtour.vlibtour_visit_emulation.Position getNextPOIPosition(@PathParam(value="user")
                                                                                                                                                                 java.lang.String user)
        gets the position of the next POI to visit when arrived at the end of the current path, that is the next POI in the visit. This position is the last one of the current path.
        Parameters:
        user - the identifier of the user.
        Returns:
        the position of the current POI.

      • stepInCurrentPath

        @GET
 @Path(value="/stepInCurrentPath/{user}")
 @Produces(value="application/json")
public static vlibtour.vlibtour_visit_emulation.Position stepInCurrentPath(@PathParam(value="user")
                                                                                                                                                               java.lang.String user)
        steps to the next position in the current path---i.e. towards the next POI. It returns the new position of the user, or the same if the end of the path is already reached.
        Parameters:
        user - the identifier of the user.
        Returns:
        the new position of the user, or the same if the end of the path is already reached.

public static vlibtour.vlibtour_visit_emulation.Position stepsInVisit(@PathParam(value="user")
                                                                                                                                                     java.lang.String user)
        when at a POI, steps in the visit---i.e. computes the path to the next POI.
        Parameters:
        user - the identifier of the user.
        Returns:
        the next position.
